poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: What was that in aid of? No one wins. Whirrs and clicks, steam bells and whistles. Someone Whirls it round his head and whizz: you don't need wings To fly. But see for landing? The whigs can claim biology and qualms Of conscience as progress. That's all. Evening brings the craws hame. Judges don their wigs. A will's read out, the heir cut off By pre-demential whims. The head-winds guide him.
